version.important: Various changes in Segue necessitate that you upgrade to a new config file as well as run the '1.3.0 update' under 'admin tools' --> 'updates' to make several changes to Segue's database and file-storage structure.
version.fix: Sites now only appear once in the 'Copy Site' bar.
version.change: Everyone and institute permissions are now not dropped on site-copy. As well, when creating a group from an existing site, the permissions are now retained.
version.fix: LDAP users are now syched with the database when they are given permissions.
When adding slots to a group, they now disapear from the site listing.
CopySite now copies all media, not just those referenced by stories.
version.new: Added a configuration checking function and some more helpful error messages so that installing and configuring Segue is more straight forward.
version.fix: Have added notes and help to themes UI indicating the Popup Window blocker software should be disabled for Segue.
Improved navigation header display. Fixed style of navigation header in bevelbox theme.
version.change: Changed side sections navigational arrangement (see: theme settings) such that links to pages of the current section appear in an indented list below section name in left navigation.
version.fix: Segue now checks that it can write to a site directory before attempting to copy media to it and prints out an informative message if it can't instead of failing with confusing errors.
Removed repeating titles for stories in the sitemap.
version.new: When copying sites or other parts of a site, discussion posts can now be coppied as well.
When viewing the logs screen, old logs are cleaned out as per a configurable number of days.
version.fix: Sites associated with a class and class sites now can properly add the class as an editor.
Segue now prints a nice error instructing the user to update thier links if a bad link tries to get a non-existant section or page and creates a corrupted section or page object.
version.new: When copying a site, section, or page, links internal to that part (such as links in a content block that point to another page in the site or section) are now updated to point to the appropriate place in the new version of the part.
version.fix: When editing slots, information about whether the slot was in use not or not is now accurate.
version.change: Added new template to config.inc.php.

Changed display of links on home page. In particular, change "Public Site Lising" to "Public Sites". Removed "links" header and removed header formatting from help link. Also added text to public site listing.
version.new: Added a config option to include registration link below login fields when there has been no authentication. Also added config option to include a external authentication help text string.

Added a config option to include forgot your password link below login fields when there has been no authentication. This allows users to request Segue to reset the passwords for their Segue user accounts (i.e. those accounts whose authentication type is "db")
version.fix:
HTMLAREA and plaintext box editing now behavies better with respect to line returns. HTMLArea submissions now have the first line return removed to prevent them from accumulating. Plain textarea line returns are converted to
tags.
version.change: Discussions now display 'cancel' buttons when in post or rate modes.
version.new: Added 'Preview as user' functionality (found in the Permissions screen) that allows the owner of a site to see what the site would look like for other users (including 'everyone' and 'institute'). This can give site owners a better understanding of the permissions system.

Added Your Posts link to home page (default.inc.php). Your posts displays all discussion/assessment posts the current user has made on all sites. Administrators will have the option to view all discussion/assessment posts across all sites for all users or find all the posts of a given user.
version.change: Changed the way internal links (i.e. links to other pages in same site) are saved when added via section and page link types and via story link types. Specifically, the full uri portion of internal link urls are replaced with a constant (similiar to Media Library path) when saved to database. This will allow for updating these links correctly when copying a site or moving a site from one instance of Segue to another.
Changed Active-X editor so that it links to the Media Library for images.
View and activate permission settings on template sites now affect who/when they appear for users creating sites.
Added the HTML Area editor to Image, Link, and File, story types.
version.fix: Fixed bug in display of stories by enclosing each story in a table to prevent edit and discuss/assess links from shifting across stories
version.change: When logging in and logging out, users are kept on the same page if possible instead of being redirected back to the default page.

The 'Site not availible' error is now more informative and includes links to "Home" as well as a "create site" link if the active user is allowed to create a site in that place. The latter is useful when taking advantage of the vhost functionality.
When Changing to a differnt active user as admin, you are now kept on the same page.
version.new: Segue can now be configured to restrict users to given sites based on the virtual host asked for. Each vhost must be set up on the webserver as well as in the Segue config.
version.fix: stripped html tags from of first 25 characters of content that is the topic of discussion and is displayed in discussion/assessment participation summary.
version.change: Changed the way semesters are defined and handled. Segue can now be configured to have as few or many semesters as desired, each with custom start/end days.
version.important: The semester-handling changes involve new config options if upgrading from Segue 1.2.x or earlier. Change also necessitates a database table change if semesters other than w,s,l,f are used. These table changes can be made by running the 1.3.0 update under 'admin tools' --> 'updates'
version.fix: Classes are now ordered by year, semester, and code on the default page.
sites.php now queries the new (as of a year ago) tables when checking for the type of a site.
Rating can now be set to zero. The default, NULL, -- set by an empty field -- is "no rating".
Public Site Listing now prints next/previous links to additional pages.
version.new: Added error-printing functions to print out backtraces neatly.

Added Media Library link to text content block UI to allow users to easily add media files to text content blocks in a way that is portable across copies of a site and can be exported from one instance of Segue to another. This Media Library link allows users to easily get urls of Media Library files to copy/paste into HTML or text editors. When text content blocks are saved to database the $cfg[uploadurl] and $sitename portions of Media Library file urls (i.e. entire url except filename) are converted to a placeholder (i.e. unique string). When text content blocks are displayed or edited (i.e. fetched from database), the url placeholder is converted back to actual current media file url (based on current $cfg[uploadurl] and site name.
version.fix: Fixed bug in media library (filebrowser.php) that prevented getting custom upload limits when called from add content block UI (add_story_form_1_item.inc)
version.change: Link type pages no longer open in new window.
Link type content blocks no longer print out urls greater than 70 characters but instead truncate their display to avoid stretching their enclosing tables.

Have changed full text link (for content blocks with extended text) so that it is appended at the end of short text as "...more." Have put an anchor on title of discuss/assess UI and added reference to this anchor in the discuss/assess link.
version.new: Have added an option to chose a discuss/assess link label. Choses are: discuss, assess, comment, review and register.
version.change: Have moved code in add_student.php that gets lists of students in class groups to new getclassstudents function in class_functions/empty.inc.php.
version.new: Have added a function in class_functions for getting list of students from class groups in Segue tables. Have also added to this function code to get a list of students in a given class from LDAP groups. This code appears in midd.inc.php and can be used as a reference for other ldap implementations.

Added student roster listing UI for class type sites. This UI allows site owners to add and remove users from their class group. In addition, class type sites will list all students in class in discussion moderation UI, regardless of whether or not they have posted to discussions/assessments on the class site.

Added visitor and guest usertypes. Visitors can participate in public discussions and can be assigned permissions. Visitors cannot view institute-only content. Guests can participate in all discussions/assessments accessible to institute users and can view institute-only content. Neither visitors nor guests are given a slot for a personal site.
version.change: Changed passwd.php to handle 1. changing passwords of users authenticated via Segue's db 2. registering new visitor type users 3. Log in of existing users.
version.new: Added user registration UI that appears in public discussions when posts are made without authentication. User registration UI requires unauthenticated users to submit their name and email address when posting to public discussions. Email address in user registration UI is checked against email addresses in user table. In addition, their is a new config option for specifying emails that cannot be registered as visitor (these would be emails address that are set up for an institution' users and part of their user account and authentication. Segue user accounts are created for users who register this way and these users are sent an email with their username (=email address) and a auto- generated password. These users are visitor usertypes.
Added an RSS Feed content type that allows the inclusion of RSS feeds into a Segue site.
version.fix: Re-wrote the canview() and hasPermission() functions. They are now more understandable and commented, as well as having less redundency. Also, they now support the visitor user-type.
HTMLArea editor automatically inserts a break tag causing stories which user do not add content to have content. Fixed this bug by deleting break tag if it is the only content in the editor
fixed bug that allowed users within institute ip range to post to discussions for only institute users without logging in.
version.change: Changed user-type output in status bar to display full words (ie, student instead of stud, professor instead of prof, etc).
version.fix: Fixed discussion post output to strip slashes, avoided extra '\' characters.
version.new: Added in public site listing feature.
version.fix: Changed semester-list in add-course admin tools view so that it corresponds to the list given in the config file instead of a static Middlebury-based list.
Fixed a UI bug in which story timestamps/editors would display "edited by ..." when nobody had done any editing.
Fixed browser sniffer bug that prevented inclusion of html editor in add_site_form_5_header.inc and add_site_form_5_footer.inc
Fixed problem uploading files to Media Library that occured in Mac Safari. Removed browser specific code from filebrowser.php
Fixed a problem uploading files to Media Library that occured in Windows Internet Explorer.
version.change: Link to edit discussion/assessment options from discussion/assessment UI now returns users back to this location (instead of page)

version.new: Added HTMLarea version 3.0 to UI for adding content, editing site headers and footers and discussion posts. 2 implementations of the editor are used, one for content blocks, site headers and footers and another for discussion posts.
version.important: The HTMLarea editor works with Mozilla 1.3 beta or higher or Windows Internet Explorer 5.5. or higher. This editor doesn't work in Safari or Mac Internet Explorer. For these browsers, a standard textarea is available.
version.new: Added UI for discussion/assessment participation summary and moderation. This UI gives site owners a list of all the participants in a given discussion/assessment or in all the discussions/assessments in the given site. This UI also allows site owners to email all the participants in given discussion/assessment or all the participants of all discussions/assessments in the given site. finally this UI allows site owners to sort all discussion posts by rating, post time or user name.
Added summary of discussion/assessment settings that is displayed for site owners when they view discussions/assessments on their sites.
version.fix: Fixed bug that allowed discussions to be enabled without granting permissions to discuss to any group/users
Fixed a problem in the _first_time_run.inc.php SQL syntax that was preventing the discussion table from being created for new installs of Segue.

Fixed some missing quotation marks, ", in "admin tools" --> "edit users" page that were causing problems with spaces in names. Thanks go to Steve from Nottingham Trent University, England, for finding this problem.

version.new: Command-line XML import/export scripts now allow for backup of Segue sites to flat XML files. For more information please reference the README in the segue/export/ directory.
version.fix: Fixed bug in admin tools search users UI (users.php) so search pagination working properly.
Posting to discussions now works reliably on all browsers (PC Internet Explorer sometimes would not post because did not interpret postform action path correctly).
Adding of editors now works in the 'discussions settings' step of the add/edit story interface.
version.important: New database fields have been added to the story and discussion tables. To add new fields, log in as an administrator, then go to 'admin tools' > 'segue updates' and run the 1.1.0 update if needed.
version.new: Added information about discussion/assessment access such as authentication requirements, information about what will be displayed to other users (e.g. author name, post content) and what post information is available to the site owner.

Added file upload UI to discussion/assessment post form. This feature will allow those who post to a discussion to attach a file. Upload UI uses the site Media Library (accessible from filebrowser.php). When the Media Library is accessed from discussion/assessment, only files uploaded by the currently authenticated user will appear (unless that user is the site owner). This new functionality will allow the discussion/assessment UI to function as an assignment/assessment dropbox.
Added option to rate discussion/assessment posts. This feature will allow site owners rate the quality of posts. In assessment mode this rating can be used as a grade.

Added option to show or hide authors of discussion/assessment posts. This feature will allow site owners to create publicly anonymous discussions while retaining their own access to the identity of discussion post authors. All users (other then the site owner) will see only then own posts identified. This feature will also allow site owners to let all users see then results of an assessment without revealing identity of assessment post authors.

Added option to show or hide discussion/assessment posts. This feature will allow site owners to use discussions as assessments. Thus if hide posts is set then posts referred to collectively as an Assessment. All users (other then the site owner) will see their own posts only.
Added option to email site owner all discussion/assessment posts. This feature will allow site owners to get email updates of posts to their discussions.
Added option to sort discussion/assessment posts by recent first or recent last, rating and author.
version.change: Information on who posted last to a given discussion/assessment has been removed. This has been done to preserve integrity of assessment mode described above.
Link to discussions have been changed from Discussion to Discuss/Assess.
Full name (instead of username) now displayed in story author and editor attribution.

The user full name, email, and type in the db are now updated from LDAP or other auth method if the db version doesn't match.
Fixed bug that prevented indentation of replies to thread in Windows Internet Explorer.

version.fix: Now doesn't attempt to perform operations on nonexistant LDAP results.
Now checks that the destination name is not the same as the source name and is also not an empty string.

version.change: LDAP authentication has been generalized and should now work with most LDAP servers.
Refined admin tools UI. Added all Segue users to add/edit user UI and allowed for searching by auth and user type. Added pagination to add/edit slots UI and refined layout of search results.
version.fix: Classes now show up if the user is an admin.
Removed link to assessments on default.inc.php
Fixed a bug in add/edit classes UI so that classes existing classes can now be edit.
Fixed a bug in the 1.0.3 permissions checking that prevented institution users from accessing sites.
Fixed a bug in fetching of sites where a user is editor, so that a database connection is guaranteed.

version.change: Default page and permissions checking re-written to be faster.
Permissions window now has Save/Cancel buttons at the top of the window.
version.important: Segue expects that usernames are all lower-case. Checks are in place to force the creation of lowercase usernames when adding users, but if you are using a custom authentication modules, these checks may be bypassed and you should check that usernames in your user table are lower-case if you see strange problems with permissions.
version.new: Addition of an update framework for applying database updates in Segue. When templates/database updates are in a release, they will appear in the "Segue Updates" section of the "admin tools".
version.change: Two new site templates: "Advanced: Single Section" and "Advanced: Blank".
version.important: New templates have been added. To create the new templates, log in as an administrator, then go to 'admin tools' --> 'segue updates' and run the 1.0.3 update if needed.
version.change: Discussions now appear in-line instead of in a popup window.
Admin screens for users, classes, slots, and logs now have improved searching and pagination.
version.fix: Anonymous/Unauthenticated discussions are now working.
Class groups not listed from members
version.change: Editors of sections can now enable discussions for that section and select which (of the already availible editors) can post to it.
version.fix: Co-Teaching profs now don't see site creation, grouping, or editing links if they are not the owner for a site. They see editing links as apropriate if they are editors.
User's Full Names containing apostrophes now don't throw errors when adding to the user table.

version.change: The admin interface has been changed so that slot and their properties can be changed along side the classes and users. Custom upload limits can be set in this slot interface now instead of editing the DB directly.
version.fix: Story problems with the [De]Activate dates have been fixed
Problems with the [De]Activate dates have been fixed
The Move/Copy UI now shows the sitename to differentiate between similarly titled sites.
Fixed the numerous bugs that were generated by the change below. (ouch)
version.change: Slots interface: administrators can now edit owner & media library size for existing slots.
version.fix: Fixed upload of PHP files bug.
version.important: DB CHANGE: The 'slot' table has a new column: 'slot_uploadlimit', which is an INT(10), corresponding to the number of bytes of the quota.
version.new: Media Library quota can be adjusted on a per-site basis through the slot database table. Add Slot interface upgraded too.
version.fix:
Upon logout, the session, instead of being completely destroyed, only unsets Segue-specific variables. The previous functionality was
also killing other apps running under the same session.

version.new:
Added new config option: $cfg[domain] -- the cookie domain for session info. Allows session info to cross sites if they are running
the same instance of segue.
Discussion links now displayed with statistics info.
version.change: By-line for default page now has a link to a "credits" page with more info about the authors.
ChangeLog is now held in XML format & converted with XSL!
"Powered by Segue" logo now takes you to the Segue page.
Permissions can now be assigned to link type sections and pages and image and file type stories.
version.fix: Headings and dividers are now properly displayed when not logged in.
version.important:
DATABASE CHANGE! The class_number field in the class table should be changed in type from an int(11) to a varchar(15) and the default set
to "000".
version.fix:
When integrated with an LDAP server, Segue now correctly synchronizes the user and class database tables when adding users/groups as editors who have not yet logged in/been added to the
local tables.
version.change: Added Dobo Radichkov's name as a main editor on Segue websites & program.
View/add slots interface: a used slot now displays a "-" under the delete column instead of non-linked "delete" text for clarity.

version.new: Owners of class sites can now easily add members of their class as an editor.
version.change: Activation/Deactivation Date form now has valid day options.
When an admin is acting as another person, they can only see what that person would see.
version.fix: The "default" page now appropriately shows sites of which a group member is owner.
Move/Copy now shows sites properly when opened on first page load.
version.change: More debug output has been removed.
Removed debug output.

version.new: First official release.
